executive_summary: Rising incomes and an aging population have translated into revenue growth for eyeglasses and contact lens stores in recent years. Higher incomes allow consumers to afford the out-of-pocket for eyeglasses not covered by their vision benefits. Two central events have also been influencing the performance of eyeglasses and contact lens retailers – the 2018 merger of EssilorLuxottica and accelerating e-commerce sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Essilor and Luxottica's Merger Continues to Redefine the Eyewear Market
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Essilor and Luxottica's major merger in 2018 combined the two companies to become the dominant leader in eyewear, EssilorLuxottica. The company's vertical integration is unmatched by other eyeglass retailers, leading EssilorLuxottica's market share to jump to nearly 50.0%. The merger has pressured independent eye retailers who can't reap the same financial or operational benefits as major eyeglass stores, accelerating consolidation activity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Aging Adults Create Opportunities for Eyeglass and Contact Lens Retailers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: - An aging population will be the main driver behind corrective eyewear sales moving forward.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry sell eyeglasses, contact lenses, sunglasses, safety eyewear and optical accessories. These retail stores may also provide fitting and lens processing services.
key_trends: Demographic and economic trends are influencing eyewear sales.
Rising incomes and an aging population are behind rising spending on eyeglasses.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged 55 and older are the largest purchasers of corrective eyewear.

products_and_services.product_description: Prescription lenses are medical devices that correct vision.

tier_1_suppliers: Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Glasses & Contacts Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Medical Instrument & Supply Manufacturing in the US
Glasses & Contact Lens Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Higher incomes encourage consumers to replace their glasses more often.

business_locations.location_description: More than one-quarter of the nation's population resides in the Southeast region.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The FTC enforces federal consumer protection laws overseeing product pricing.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Industry assistance level is low and steady, indicating a factor for increased barriers to entry.

factors_increased_barrier: Industry assistance level is low and steady

basis_points.basis_description: A handful of major eyeglass retailers dominate the market.

concentration_points.concentration_title: EssilorLuxottica is the largest eyewear retailer
concentration_points.concentration_description: EssilorLuxottica is the largest eyewear retailer in the US due to its vertical integration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Managing purchase expenses is critical for eyeglass shops.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Since consumers consider eyewear a retail and a healthcare purchase.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Consumers adjust retail spending based on changes in economic conditions.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Eyewear retailers earn most of their revenue through prescription lens sales.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Eyeglasses and contact lens stores tend to be more diversified in order to differentiate themselves from competitors.
